intro: Amoana, commonly known as the kokia, is a rare flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is known for its slow growth and long lifespan. Amoana has small, compound leaves and produces pods that contain seeds. Due to habitat loss and other threats, it is considered an endangered species.
